title: (x) Childrens' letter blocks - various {gang}
content:
Hi all,

I'm doing some modeling in Max, creating some childrens' letter blocks for a scene, and I'm not sure as to what font to use for the "letters".

Here is an image of the letter blocks I'm referrencing:

[http://www.bbc.co.uk/parenting/images/300/letter\_blocks.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082251/http:/www.bbc.co.uk/parenting/images/300/letter_blocks.jpg "http://www.bbc.co.uk/parenting/images/300/letter\_blocks.jpg")

Any ideas what font that might be - or a font that would be a close simile?

Thank you so much for your help

Dodge

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [letter\_blocks.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082251/http:/typophile.com/files/letter_blocks.jpg) | 7.17 KB |
author: Dodger21

comments.content:
anything nice and 'blocky' would work. (sorry, bad pun.)

Bookman: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bookman/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082251/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bookman/bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bookman/bold/")

Clarendon: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/clarendon/ef-extra-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082251/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/clarendon/ef-extra-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/clarendon/ef-extra-bold/")

Beton: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/beton-sb/xbold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120108082251/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/beton-sb/xbold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/beton-sb/xbold/")
One of those blocks (the one with the C) is ITC American Typewriter. Clarendon and similar fonts would be fairly archetypal.
I was actually gonna contribute a suggestion for once and say Clarendon but i'm too slow. :D Good luck!
I had a set of blocks like this when I was a kid that had Cooper Black on them.

i thought of cooper black too, before i saw he image...  
I guess Jonathon and I had the same blocks...
